page.title: 01General Introduction.
page.content: This project is the work of the nineteen pupils of{Eglingham C.E.First {School}aided by their parents and friends in the community. Each of the sixteen school families undertook a different aspect and the teachers are grateful for their co-operation. { Eglingham}(pronounced Eg-ling-jam) whose Anglo Saxon name{Ecwulfincham, meant{Egwulf people's homestead, belonged to Tynemouth Priory.It passed to the Ogle family and later became the property of the Milvains who owned all the land and houses until recently The region is steeped in history. There is evidence of Ancient Briton, Anglo-Saxon and Roman occupation. At {Harehope}(Hare-up) there was a leper hospital. More laterly in the nineteenth century was the case of the {Eglingham Burglaries}which brought about the introduction of{Legal Aid.
